question: Recently, the Union Cabinet chaired by the Prime Minister has approved the change in definitions of MSMEs based on their annual turnover and investments made in plants. As per new definitions, a medium enterprise is defined as a unit with annual turnover ranging between _?
explanation: The Union Cabinet chaired by the Prime Minister recently approved the change in definitions of Micro, Small and Medium enterprises based on “investment in plant & machinery/equipment” to “annual turnover” basis. As per new definitions, a micro enterprise will be defined as a unit where the annual turnover does not exceed five crore rupees; a small enterprise will be defined as a unit where the annual turnover is more than five crore rupees but does not exceed Rs 75 crore; and a medium enterprise will be defined as a unit where the annual turnover is more than seventy-five crore rupees but does not exceed Rs 250 crore.
